io.spine.server.command

Annotation Type Command


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Command
    Marks a commanding method.

    A commanding method must:

    • be annotated with @Command;
    • return a command message derived from CommandMessage, if there is only one command to be generated; or an Iterable of command messages for two or more commands;
    • accept one of the following as the first parameter:
      • a command message;
      • an event message;
      • a rejection message.

    A commanding method may accept a context of the incoming message (CommandContext or EventContext correspondingly) as the second parameter, if handling of the command requires its context.

    If the annotation is applied to a method which doesn't satisfy any of these requirements, this method is not considered a command handler and is not registered for command generation.

    Throwables

    A commanding method may throw a ThrowableMessage if, and only if it accepts a command message. This means that the incoming command may be either rejected, or substituting command(s) must be generated.

    Throwing other types in command transforming methods is not allowed.

    Commanding methods accepting events or rejections may not throw.

    Access Modifiers

    A commanding method should have package-private access. It will allow calling this method from tests. The method should not be public because it is not supposed to be called directly.

    Handle or Transform a Command

    An application can either handle an incoming command or transform it into one or more commands that will be handled instead. Because of this, a commanding method cannot accept a command message, if there is already a command handling method which accepts the command message type.

    If a commanding method accepts a command type which is also handled by the application by another method, a run-time error will occur. This also means that an application cannot have two commanding methods that accept the same command type.

    See Also:
    Handling Commands

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean external
      When true, the annotated method receives an event generated from outside of the Bounded Context to which the annotated method's class belongs.

    • Element Detail

      • external

        public abstract boolean external
        When true, the annotated method receives an event generated from outside of the Bounded Context to which the annotated method's class belongs.

        Should only be applied to commander methods that accept an event or rejection as a parameter.

        If applied to a command receiving method, the Model error is produced.

        Default:
        false
